title: How to Make a Felt Treasure Box from a Baby Wipes Box

steps.headline: Choose the felt and paint colors according to your own taste.
steps.description: If you are pink-happy, then choose a range of pinks. If you're into blues and greens, then err on the side of those hues.

steps.headline: Decide on the design.
Prepare the backing templates.
steps.description: These are the background pieces of felt that cover the entirety of the box edges and lid. Measure the lid and side edges, then transfer this to paper. Cut out templates for the felt.

steps.headline: Prepare the design templates.
steps.description: If you're adding anything else, such as geometric shapes, animals, trees, beach balls, etc., draw these on the paper first, then cut out the templates.

steps.headline: Place the paper templates on the relevant felt colors.
steps.description: Use pins to keep the paper templates in place.

steps.headline: Cut out the backing templates first.
steps.description: Set aside to use shortly. If you want the backing to have fancy edges, use pinking shears or decorative edged scissors.

steps.headline: Cut out the design templates next.
steps.description:
Set aside to use shortly. If the designs have layers, pin them together for now, so as not to lose any of the pieces. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/ad\/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/ad\/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

parts.name: Putting the Felt on the Baby Wipes Box

steps.headline: Stick the backing felt on first.
steps.description: Place glue on the box and a little on the felt, then press each piece in place, covering both the lid and the sides of the box. Adjust as needed while the glue is still wet; straighten up any crooked edges. Let dry before proceeding.

steps.headline: Glue the designs in place.
steps.description: Depending on your original design plan, place the design pieces wherever you wish them to be. For example, you might have a flower in one corner of the lid and in a corner of each side panel. Let dry.

steps.headline: Finish the edge of the lid.
steps.description: Although you could leave this part of the box bare, it is nice to dress it up too. Ribbon, braid, lace or yarn could be glued around the lid edge, in a complementary color. Let dry before using.

steps.headline: Add a label or name tag.
steps.description: This step is optional but is ideal if you want it known to whom the box belongs or what it contains. Simply cut out a small geometric shape (square, rectangle, circle, etc.) in another color of felt. Write a person's or item's name on this using a fabric pen (use dots if it's hard to write on the felt), then glue in place on the lid or front side of the box.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: The felt treasure box is now ready for use.

text:
Choosing the Colors and Theme Choose the felt and paint colors according to your own taste. If you are pink-happy, then choose a range of pinks. If you're into blues and greens, then err on the side of those hues. Decide on the design. It can be as simple as sticking plain felt panels to the box but for something more interesting, add layers and objects in different colors of felt. Some ideas include: A beachside scene: Blue background with yellow sand, shell designs, a beach umbrella and a beach ball{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} A nature scene: Green grass, blue sky, a tree, some birds, a squirrel and a pond with ducks{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d6/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d6/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} A floral theme: Pink background with purple and orange flowers placed here and there{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/38/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/38/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} A car theme: A red background with cars in blue and yellow dotted here and there{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} And so forth! Preparing the Design Templates Prepare the backing templates. These are the background pieces of felt that cover the entirety of the box edges and lid. Measure the lid and side edges, then transfer this to paper. Cut out templates for the felt. Prepare the design templates. If you're adding anything else, such as geometric shapes, animals, trees, beach balls, etc., draw these on the paper first, then cut out the templates. Cutting the Felt Place the paper templates on the relevant felt colors. Use pins to keep the paper templates in place. Cut out the backing templates first. Set aside to use shortly. If you want the backing to have fancy edges, use pinking shears or decorative edged scissors. Cut out the design templates next. Set aside to use shortly. If the designs have layers, pin them together for now, so as not to lose any of the pieces. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Felt-Treasure-Box-from-a-Baby-Wipes-Box-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Putting the Felt on the Baby Wipes Box Stick the backing felt on first. Place glue on the box and a little on the felt, then press each piece in place, covering both the lid and the sides of the box. Adjust as needed while the glue is still wet; straighten up any crooked edges. Let dry before proceeding. Glue the designs in place. Depending on your original design plan, place the design pieces wherever you wish them to be. For example, you might have a flower in one corner of the lid and in a corner of each side panel. Let dry. Finish the edge of the lid. Although you could leave this part of the box bare, it is nice to dress it up too. Ribbon, braid, lace or yarn could be glued around the lid edge, in a complementary color. Let dry before using. Add a label or name tag. This step is optional but is ideal if you want it known to whom the box belongs or what it contains. Simply cut out a small geometric shape (square, rectangle, circle, etc.) in another color of felt. Write a person's or item's name on this using a fabric pen (use dots if it's hard to write on the felt), then glue in place on the lid or front side of the box. Done. The felt treasure box is now ready for use.
